comment: He's a game design professor who either is really bad at explaining his thoughts or just has never really played any games in a really long time. Really bad professor.

The class is meant to be a space for students to group up and make a game and he constantly forgets this idea. He would call something a "playtesting day" and then make us do presentations instead of actual playtesting because he did not know what playtesting was. He's also an AI bro who wants everyone to use generative AI.

I absolutely loved my summer semester online 3D Modeling and Animation course with this professor. In the feedback of our first modeling exercise I received a 20-minute personalized review of my assignment and challenge points I had noted down as part of the assignment. Also accommodated me working ahead by grading some parts of a project early.
Insanely rough grader for no reason, we asked him for feedback on a project before we submitted it, applied all the feedback, and he still have us a 70 something.

The class was fun, and group projects can be solo projects, but that might make the workload bigger as all the projects revolve around making board games + mini-essays, and eventually building physical models. The professor's lectures are very interesting, but personally I would go through the slides again on D2L to prepare for quizzes and tests.

His lectures are hard to follow and he has little control over his class. The materials he provides in Brightspace however, are super interesting and enjoyable to read. Lots of group projects and quizzes, but they're pretty easy. The exams are easy as well.

This professor is solid. His lectures are unorganized and difficult to follow, but the resources outside of the lecture (textbook, articles, and videos) are really good so it's easy to understand the material we need to study. Graded material is also very easy. The only tests are just weekly quizzes. Lots of group work.
